answers.answer: Oh and I'm also starting to feel overly tired again. Like I just want to sleep, but I'm not really tired and I get plenty of sleep.

omg.. i feel the same way my mind is telling me move and workout, go running, jump up and down, go out with your boyfriend for a fun night.   But my body or whatever is just feeling like if i didnt have to stand my body would just fall and i would sleep all day and night.  i could get 5 hours or 8 or 9 hours and i still feel as if i got 1hr.. if any.    I think my dosage needs to be increased cause its been a year since my first test that he based the dosage on.  and since then dealing with the diabetes over that was ok. but now i feel i need to concentrate on that for a bit to.
Yes, I'd say you need a new test and a higher dose. You should be tested every 4 to 6 weeks untill you stabalize. Then about every 6 months to a year or when you start to feel bad again.

oh wow, really?  I havent been tested since last march and didnt go back to the doc until June to find out.  Those results are what he based everything on.  The diabetes ofcourse he's had me go back for but he had even told me once the diabetes was undercontrol we'd worry about the thyroid.  So now im gonna tell him.. Lets work on this thyroid problem.

question: Hello - I've been taking Levoxyl 150 now for little over a month, before that I was on 125, before that it was in increment increases of 12. I continuously feel like I have weak muscles, eye pressure, and leg cramps (especially if I do a cat stretch in bed the wrong way). On this new does, I feel like my heart is pumping louder or that I have trouble breathing -- not sure which it really is? In the past with higher doses, especially once I hit the 100 level, I would occasionally experience rapid heart beats, but once I adjusted to the new level they would go away. I always have neck pain and cracky neck bones and my tendons in my arms and neck are always tight! Tight arm/neck tendon was a problem even before I started any type of treatment and so was the weak muscle in the legs feeling -- something that lead me to believe there was something wrong with me in the first place. My TSH numbers, the last I checked were in the mid 3's -- occasionally it drops to a mid to high 2 (I've felt my best in the low 2's). Another huge bother is that I often feel like my tongue is enlarged making it sore because it is always either pressed up against my teeth or stuck in between them. I find at times it is difficult for me to get my words out or find the right words -- the words issues is often really bad whenever my TSH number increase (when it was up in the 6 to 8 range I felt I couldn't even speak!). And my ankles swell, especially my left one. The ankles and swollen tongue were not a factor before I started medications, but the speach/word issues was. This almost seems to be worse when my tongue feels swollen. There was a short while there when I was on my previous dosage level that my ankles were not swelling. Not sure if this is do to my by body fully adjusting to the 125? I was on that dosages for the longest period of time (maybe 6 months?) compared to any other dose that I've been on. Though, after a while, I found my TSH numbers to rise again. I also have put on 30 to 40 pounds in the last 3 years (some of this I blame on the Hypo, some on lack of exercise and stress eating - I gained 20 in one month when I went off meds and my numbers skyrocketed -- a really bad choice on my part!).My doc went for a larger increase this last time because she felt that maybe since I've had a large weight gain and the fluctuation in my numbers and continued symptoms, that maybe I wasn't absorbing as much as I should be.Any suggestions?
title: Side effects or wrong doseage?
